docs.snippet: Republican officials rejected an emotional plea Monday to back off the GOP's opposition to same-sex marriage, renewing the party's embrace of religious conservative values as delegates prepared to welcome Donald Trump to their national convention....
docs.lead_paragraph: Republican officials rejected an emotional plea Monday to back off the GOP's opposition to same-sex marriage, renewing the party's embrace of religious conservative values as delegates prepared to welcome Donald Trump to their national convention.

headline.main: GOP Rejects Call to Back Off Gay Marriage Opposition
headline.print_headline: GOP Rejects Call to Back Off Gay Marriage Opposition

docs.snippet: China's economic growth likely cooled to a fresh seven-year low of 6.6 percent in the second quarter as the industrial sector loses steam and a boost from financial services fades, according to a Reuters poll of 61 economists....
docs.lead_paragraph: China's economic growth likely cooled to a fresh seven-year low of 6.6 percent in the second quarter as the industrial sector loses steam and a boost from financial services fades, according to a Reuters poll of 61 economists.

headline.main: China Second-Quarter Economic Growth Seen Cooling to 6.6 Percent, Weakest in Seven Years
headline.print_headline: China Second-Quarter Economic Growth Seen Cooling to 6.6 Percent, Weakest in Seven Years

docs.snippet: Xerox Corp, which is on track to split into two companies by the end of the year, has been in talks to acquire financial printing firm RR Donnelley & Sons Co, according to two people familiar with the matter....

headline.main: Xerox in Talks to Buy Financial Printer RR Donnelley: Sources
headline.print_headline: Xerox in Talks to Buy Financial Printer RR Donnelley: Sources

docs.snippet: Cuba has opened a shop in Havana that could eventually operate as the Communist-ruled island's first wholesale store for the fledgling private sector, offering products in bulk at lower prices than in expensive retail outlets....

docs.snippet: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Monday approved Shire Plc's lifitegrast eye drops for treating signs and symptoms of dry eye disease, allowing the company to bring to market its most important pipeline medicine....

headline.main: FDA Approves Shire's Keenly-Watched Eye Drug

docs.snippet: A gregarious leader with voluminous contacts, Mr. Brademas transformed the university from a commuter school into a premier residential research and teaching institutions....
docs.lead_paragraph: A gregarious leader with voluminous contacts, Mr. Brademas transformed the university from a commuter school into a premier residential research and teaching institutions.
docs.abstract: John Brademas, former Indiana congressman who was responsible for raising academic and artistic standards at New York University during tenure as university president, dies at age 89.

headline.main: John Brademas, Indiana Congressman and N.Y.U. President, Dies at 89
headline.print_headline: John Brademas, 89, Ex-Representative Who Elevated N.Y.U. as Its Leader, Dies

docs.snippet: Maintaining stability in financial markets should not be an explicit goal for the Federal Reserve, which should use interest rates to head off a crisis only if more precise and better-suited tools fail, a top Fed official said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Maintaining stability in financial markets should not be an explicit goal for the Federal Reserve, which should use interest rates to head off a crisis only if more precise and better-suited tools fail, a top Fed official said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Financial Stability Should Not Become Fed's Third Mandate: Mester
headline.print_headline: Financial Stability Should Not Become Fed's Third Mandate: Mester

docs.snippet: A 65-year-old Russian adventurer was drifting east across the Australian Outback in a balloon on Tuesday in a bid to set a record for flying solo around the world nonstop....

headline.main: Russian Launches Balloon in Australia in Record Attempt
